item.title: Etain add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etain add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes you wake up. Sometimes the fall kills you. And sometimes, when you fall, you fly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etain add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Etain add a quote by Amelia Atwater-Rhodes
item.description: "Those who cannot be aggressive are hunted down while they shiver and hide because the night is dark." -- Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

item.title: Etain add a quote by Amelia Atwater-Rhodes
item.description: "I'm standing in a slaughterhouse where the cattle are begging to become hamburgers. I have a right to be jumpy." -- Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

item.title: Etain add a quote by Amelia Atwater-Rhodes
item.description: "Life is nothing without a little chaos to make it interesting." -- Amelia Atwater-Rhodes

item.title: Etain add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Etain add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Etain add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Etain add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Etain add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etain add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Etain add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Etain add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Etain add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Happiness, not in another place but this place...not for another hour, but this hour." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Etain add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "I really think I write about everyday life. I don't think I'm quite as odd as others say I am. Life is intrinsically, well, boring and dangerous at the same time. At any given moment the floor may open up. Of course, it almost never does; that's what makes it so boring." -- Edward Gorey

item.title: Etain add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Etain add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "The most important thing is to enjoy your life—to be happy—it's all that matters." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Etain add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "If I knew that today would be the last time I’d see you, I would hug you tight and pray the Lord be the keeper of your soul. If I knew that this would be the last time you pass through this door, I’d embrace you, kiss you, and call you back for one more. If I knew that this would be the last time I would hear your voice, I’d take hold of each word to be able to hear it over and over again. If I knew this is the last time I see you, I’d tell you I love you, and would not just assume foolishly you know it already." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Etain add a quote by Daphne DuMaurier
item.description: "Boredom is a pleasing antidote for fear" -- Daphne DuMaurier

item.title: Etain add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Etain add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Last night I dreamt I went to Manderley again." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Etain add a quote by Bela Lugosi
item.description: "It is women who love horror. Gloat over it. Feed on it. Are nourished by it. Shudder and cling and cry out-and come back for more." -- Bela Lugosi

item.title: Etain add a quote by Bela Lugosi
item.description: "I will not be tortured, I tear torture out of myself by torturing you!" -- Bela Lugosi

item.title: Etain add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Etain add a quote by Margaret Lee Runbeck
item.description: "Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts." -- Margaret Lee Runbeck

item.title: Etain add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit." -- Aristotle

item.title: Etain add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Etain add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Etain add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas
